recipes.title: Julia Child’s Chocolate Mousse
recipes.instructions: Beat egg yolks and sugar together until mixture is thick, pale yellow, and falls back upon itself forming a slowly dissolving ribbon. Beat in orange liquor.Set the bowl over a pot of not-quite-simmering water and continue beating for 3-4 minutes until the mixture is foamy and too hot for your finger.Then beat it over a bowl of cold water for 3-4 minutes until the mixture is cool and again forms the ribbon. It will have the consistency of mayonnaise.Melt chocolate and coffee over a pot of hot water. Remove from heat and beat in butter a bit at a time, to make a smooth cream. Beat the chocolate into the egg yolks and optional orange peel.Beat the egg whites and salt until soft peaks are formed; sprinkle on sugar and beat till stiff peaks are formed. Stir one fourth of the egg whites into the chocolate mixture. Fold in the rest.Turn into serving dish, dessert cups or petits pots. Refrigerate at least 2 hours or overnight.

steps.step: Beat egg yolks and sugar together until mixture is thick, pale yellow, and falls back upon itself forming a slowly dissolving ribbon. Beat in orange liquor.Set the bowl over a pot of not-quite-simmering water and continue beating for 3-4 minutes until the mixture is foamy and too hot for your finger.Then beat it over a bowl of cold water for 3-4 minutes until the mixture is cool and again forms the ribbon. It will have the consistency of mayonnaise.Melt chocolate and coffee over a pot of hot water.

Remove from heat and beat in butter a bit at a time, to make a smooth cream. Beat the chocolate into the egg yolks and optional orange peel.Beat the egg whites and salt until soft peaks are formed; sprinkle on sugar and beat till stiff peaks are formed. Stir one fourth of the egg whites into the chocolate mixture. Fold in the rest.Turn into serving dish, dessert cups or petits pots. Refrigerate at least 2 hours or overnight.
